page.title: 02BOATBUILDING SEAHOUSES
page.content: Seahouses Boatyard is a family firm, Ralph Dawson & Sons established in 1947. There are four workers all related, Ronnie Dawson 51, Archbold Dawson 48, Ivan Graham 23 and Ian Dawson 21. The firm build and repair fishing boats of up to 60feet in length. These are either Stern Trawlers or smaller boats called Cobles. All their boats are constructed of wood, Oak for the frame and Larch for the planks, which is British Timber and is supplied from Hull. They only use Fibre Glass for parts such as Deck Shelters and Wheelhouses. The boat under construction at this time is a 36 feet Stern Trawler which will cost in the region of Â£60000 and will take 7 to 8 months to complete.{ { {
